Legal_Issue: Was the Board's decision to deny refugee status based on lack of subjective fear and credibility reasonable?
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's delayed flight from Colombia and failure to claim asylum in the U.S. undermined credibility
Evidence_Type: Testimonial evidence, timeline of travel and asylum claims
Legal_Provision: Section 96 and Section 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution by FARC in Colombia
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of subjective fear and inconsistent behavior with genuine fear
Proceeding_Type: Administrative hearing followed by judicial review
Regulation_Cited: IRPR Section 101(1) - Factors in determining refugee status
Application_Error: Failure to apply for asylum in first safe country (U.S.)
Application_Factor: Timing of departure and asylum application
Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of credibility and fear assessment
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA Section 96 - Definition of Convention Refugee
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of subjective fear and credibility concerns
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in applicant's timeline and actions
Procedural_Fairness: Decision found to be transparent, justified, and intelligible
Credibility_Issues: Delayed flight, prolonged stay in U.S. without seeking asylum
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of Board's credibility findings
Procedural_Issue: Timeliness and forum of asylum application
Omission_Type: Failure to seek protection in first safe country
